answers.answer: I just took mine today and I'm not big nor am i small and size has nothing to do with it but i failed mine was 185 so have to go back for a 3 hr one i mean it all depends on your body i know ppl that are smaller then me that had it so it's all up to your body but i mean size can probably play apart depending on how big you are and there is a girl at my job gotta be 250 300 pounds and don't have it so it all up to the body
And they said i lost 2 pounds but my baby is 2 pounds and is right where she needs to be so it all depends
Oh ok thank you it just worries me cuz I'm a ftm so I'm just all out of whack about it.
I weigh 165 and I took mine today and felt fine. The doctor drew my blood and I left and went to lunch with my fiance :) weight doesn't have anything to do with it.
I'm in that not big, but not tiny either category,  and I failed my one hour, and went in and had the three hour and it turned out fine. :) so even if you fail your one hour don't panic
Your weight doesn't have anything to do with it. Skinny 120 pound women can have gestational diabetes. I was  182 when i took the test...failed the 1 hour but passed the 3 hour test.
I was considered overweight with my first two pregnancies and passed without a problem. Weight is not the determining factor. Keep eating healthy.
Yes cuz I love my fruits and veggies and surprisingly so does my baby lol thanks guys :)
I'm not obease and I'm not skinny and I passed mine
I passed mine but still have to take the three hr one just because my little girl is too big i weight 210 and before preg i wss 194

question: Well my question is. I'm not skinny but I'm not obese either it's hard to explain will I fail because of my weight automatically or just because they give it to you? My mom tells me I'm going to have it. I've been eating healthy and doing my best to lose weight so when this baby comes out I lost instead of gained. I need input please!
title: glucose test?
